title: Understanding Freeze Worksheet Feature
text: In a spreadsheet, using the 'freeze' feature allows you to keep certain rows or columns visible, regardless of how far you scroll through the rest of the data. Freezing panes can be especially useful when dealing with large datasets where the first row contains headers or important information that you always want to see.

title: How to Identify Rows or Columns to Freeze
text: Determine which sections of your spreadsheet you want constant visibility of. These are usually the rows or columns containing titles, labels, or other crucial identifiers that should remain on screen as you navigate through your data.

title: Accessing the Freeze Function in Google Sheets
text: In Google Sheets, you can find the freeze feature in the View menu at the top of the interface. This allows you to select how many rows or columns you want to freeze.
